messages.message:
Who has context on the prod nginx-config configmap?

I am working on trying to move our nginx config to the new templated configmap model so that we can have a single source of truth for nginx instead of a separate copy of it for each environment.  This way new nginx configs only have to be added in one place.

I was able to do this for saas and dogfood pretty easily, but the prod nginx-config is much different. For example, it has a separate server block for staging.instabase.com (http://staging.instabase.com) that seems to be a partial duplicate of the other one.
@Ashwin should have more context on this …
I have some context on the prod nginx (from adding new marketing website endpoints), but Im not sure why we have a separate staging block. That has existed since before my time

We can delete staging.instabase.com (http://staging.instabase.com), this is long dead. iirc this was from the early days of instabase when we tried to setup a secondary prod instance and we’d try to swap between prod and staging to avoid downtime. My guess is it should’ve been @Ashish who added this.
